sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 72 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C72, the alternating group A4 × C3 × C2, or one of the 51 non-abelian groups of order 72.
message_1: What is the number of non-isomorphic groups of order 72, and can you provide an example of a non-abelian group of order 72 that is not isomorphic to either the cyclic group C72 or the alternating group A4 × C3 × C2?
message_2:
There are 10 non-isomorphic groups of order 72. One example of a non-abelian group of order 72 that is not isomorphic to either the cyclic group C72 or the alternating group A4 × C3 × C2 is the semidirect product of C9 and C8, denoted as C9 ⋊ C8.

To construct this group, let α be a generator of C9 and β be a generator of C8. Define the action of β on α as follows:

β(α) = α^2

Then, the semidirect product C9 ⋊ C8 can be represented as the set of elements {α^i β^j | 0 ≤ i ≤ 8, 0 ≤ j ≤ 7} with the following multiplication rule:

(α^i β^j)(α^k β^l) = α^i β^j α^k β^l = α^i α^(2j * k) β^j β^l = α^(i + 2j * k) β^(j + l)

This group is non-abelian and not isomorphic to either C72 or A4 × C3 × C2.
